definitions: the following of ancient Greek or Roman principles and style in art and literature, generally associated with harmony, restraint, and adherence to recognized standards of form and craftsmanship, especially from the Renaissance to the 18th century.
shortDefinitions: following of ancient Greek or Roman principles and style in art and literature

definitions: the following of traditional and long-established theories or styles

examples.text: he would never substitute arid classicism for personal taste and character

shortDefinitions: following of traditional and long-established theories or styles
